name: Mojo Shrimp
author: Yoly
summary: Cuban-inspired shrimp marinated in a mixture of orange juice, lime juice, and both zests to compensate for the hard-to-find bitter oranges. I serve it with white rice, crusty bread, a green salad, and the mojo sauce on the side for dipping.
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp - peeled, deveined, and butterflied
directions: Combine 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, lime juice and zest, orange juice and zest, garlic, oregano, salt, black pepper, and cumin in a bowl
Add shrimp, cover, and place in the refrigerator to marinade for 4 to 6 hours
Heat 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet
Add shrimp and cook until pink, 4 to 7 minutes
Remove shrimp from skillet and set aside
Pour marinade into the skillet, bring to a boil, and simmer until slightly thickened, 5 to 8 minutes
Serve shrimp with marinade sauce on the side
